oai_dc:dc.dc:description: What a Maiden must eat and avoid (L II.28. 2520
2524). How a New Maiden is treated, has been told in the Katkop dialect, by !kw iten ta ||ken (L VI.
4003); who also narrates the use made by Bushman Maidens of a kind of red stone (L VI.

3974). New maidens lie in the house of seclusion for one month (from the half of one moon to another). Included are details of where they are secluded, why they cannot look at people and walk about, what they eat and do during this time, and who cares for them.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: What is done with a 'new' maiden
